Katakana and hiragana cluster in strings between 1 to 4 chars at random points in each paragraph. Hiragana occurs more often at the end of sentences, rather in clumps of 1 to 4 chars rather than just single chars. Katakana is very unlikely to appear as a single character in Japanese text, but hiragana could. Exclamation and question marks are "double-byte", not standard ascii ones. Suggestions for improvements or alternatives are </span><a style="color:#4682b4" href="mailto:mail@lorem-ipsum.info">welcome</a><span style="color:#4682b4">.</span></p></p></p></p></p></p></p>
